page.title: 13HOUSING IN PORT GLASGOW
page.content: Most houses in Port Glasgow are owned either by the District Council or by the Scottish Special Housing Association. There are some privately owned houses in the Lilybank area in the extreme west of the town and also some privately rented tenement flats in central Port Glasgow. This central area has a fairly high proportion of elderly people whose families have moved "up the hill" or left the district. Families on the Council housing list also show a distinct preference for housing in the town centre. To meet the needs of the elderly the District Council has built {sheltered housing}. There is also a policy of granting tenancies in certain multi storey blocks only to the elderly, the physically handicapped and to families with older children.
